page.title: 01An Introduction to Ulverston
page.content: {Ulverston}is a small,old market town situated just south of the{Lake Dist- {rict National Park}in the Furness Pen- insula. It is attractively set between the sea and the hills. It has 12,000 people,is administered by S.Lakeland District Council and has an active Town Council.It was granted its Market Charter in 1280,and more recently has developed industrially. The older ind- ustries were iron ore mining,cotton, milling and tanning.Now Glaxochem have one of the largest antibiotic plants in Europe here. The town may have gained its name from a Viking leader, Ulph - hence "Ulph's town". Some{famous people}from Ulverston include : Stan Laurel,Sir John Barrow, Lord Birkett,Norman Gifford and two Victoria Cross heroes,Weston and Jefferson,some of whom are remembered in street and school names.
